author: James Fink
title: United flights resume in Buffalo, nationwide following brief grounding
text:
United flights resume in Buffalo, nationwide following brief grounding Jul 8, 2015, 10:14am EDT Enlarge United Airlines None of the 15 United Airlines flights scheduled to depart from Buffalo Niagara International Airport were impacted by the nationwide grounding Wednesday morning of all United airplanes by the Federal Aviation Administration . At issue, was a computerized “automation issue”, according the FAA. The nationwide grounding lasted less than two hours. Around 10 a.m., the FAA put out an advisory saying the ground stop had been lifted for United flights and that the automation issue had been resolved. Home of the Day See All Homes of the Day “We experienced a network connectivity issue this morning,” United said in a prepared statement. “We are working to resolve this and apologize to our customers for any inconvenience.” United has seven scheduled flights from Buffalo to Newark, three to Dulles International Airport in Washington and five to Chicago’s Midway Airport. United, in May, handled 23,345 outbound passengers at the airport, roughly 14 percent of the outbound passenger count for the month. The airline carrier is one of the biggest in the country, serving approximately 16 million passengers a day.
